facts: Some of the oldest known art is cave painting made over 30,000 years ago using charcoal, clay, and minerals.
The colors in many paintings come from pigments, which can be made from rocks, plants, insects, or modern chemicals.
Artists use perspective, a set of tricks with lines and size, to make flat pictures look like they have depth.
In a fresco, artists paint on wet plaster so the color becomes part of the wall as it dries.
Sculptures can be carved by removing material, like marble, or built by adding material, like clay or metal.
Museums often control light, temperature, and humidity to help protect artworks from fading, cracking, or growing mold.
